author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 55-year-old woman was charred to death and six others sustained serious burns as a youth set fire to the house of his in-laws at Tiruvettanallur under Chokkampatti police station limits on Wednesday following a quarrel with his wife.

Police said that Senthurpandian, an alcoholic from Vadakarai near Shencottai, married Muthurani of Tiruvettanallur three years ago. Following repeated quarrels between the couple, Muthurani’s mother E. Subbulakshmi shifted them to Chokkampatti from where she was going for work in a textile unit at Rajapalayam.

When an altercation broke out between Muthurani and Senthurpandian on Tuesday night, she went to her mother’s house and then went to the mill for nightshift.

Senthurpandian, who thought that his wife was in his mother-in-law’s house, allegedly poured petrol on the hut and set it afire.

Subbulakshmi was charred to death on the spot.

Her daughter Muthu Priya (21), son Muthukumar (31), another daughter Malathi (29), Malathi’s husband Poovaiah (31), Poovaiah’s daughter Subhashree (8) and son Sudharshana Prabhu (7) sustained burns and have been admitted to Tirunelveli Medical College Hospital.

Chokkampatti police have registered a case and are investigating.
title: One charred to death as youth sets fire to hut
